title: Incorrect compilation instructions for Mac
body_html:
The instructions at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch#from-source for compiling from source say to use the following command on macOS:

MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 CC=clang CXX=clang++ python setup.py install

Why I try to compile with that command, it fails with the following error:

torch/csrc/distributed/Module.cpp:4:10: fatal error: 'unordered_map' file not
      found
#include <unordered_map>

I was able to get it to compile by using the following command instead:

MACOS_DEPOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 CC=clang CXX=clang++ CPPFLAGS="-stdlib=libc++" python setup.py install

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): Source
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): See above
  • OS: macOS 10.13.4
  • PyTorch version: Latest code from repository
  • Python version: 3.6.1

body:
The instructions at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch#from-source for compiling from source say to use the following command on macOS:

```
MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 CC=clang CXX=clang++ python setup.py install
```

Why I try to compile with that command, it fails with the following error:

```
torch/csrc/distributed/Module.cpp:4:10: fatal error: 'unordered_map' file not
      found
#include <unordered_map>
```

I was able to get it to compile by using the following command instead:

```
MACOS_DEPOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 CC=clang CXX=clang++ CPPFLAGS="-stdlib=libc++" python setup.py install
```

## System Info

- PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): Source
- Build command you used (if compiling from source): See above
- OS: macOS 10.13.4
- PyTorch version: Latest code from repository
- Python version: 3.6.1
